comments:
Linked files/folders can be linked to "Linked Resources" path variable (defined under Preferences) relative paths. e.g. projectRoot/src would link to c:/fooProject/src if projectRoot path variable is set to c:/fooProject

When I try to open the property sheet of such a linked folder, Eclipse is popping up a window with the title:

Could Not Accept Changes

displaying the message:

The currently displayed page contains invalid values.

Clicking on the OK button, the "Properties for ..." titled property sheet does get raised. However, the Location: is listed as Unknown, which is not as I expected (the Resolved location: is also listed as Unknown, but this is as would be expected when missing path variables deny resolution).

This also appears to me to be a regression from Eclipse 3.1, where the property sheet opened without the described pop-up, and as desired, displayed the Location: with value such as the earlier described projectRoot/src.

The build information follows.

eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_AU
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86
